book_name_ar: كتاب الفقه المنسوب لزيد بن علي
book_name_en: Fiqh Book attributed to Zaid ibn Ali
english_translation: Narrated from Ali that two men were partners during the time of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. One of them was devoted to the market and trading, while the other was devoted to the mosque and prayer behind the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. When it came time to divide the profit, the one devoted to the market said: Favor me, for I was devoted to trading while you were devoted to the mosque. So they came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and mentioned that to him, so the Prophet ﷺ said: The one devoted to the market, you were only provided for your sustenance because of your partner's devotion to the mosque.

book_name_ar: كتاب الفقه المنسوب لزيد بن علي
book_name_en: Fiqh Book attributed to Zaid ibn Ali
english_translation: Narrated from Ali regarding the two partners: Profit is according to what they agreed upon, and loss is according to the proportion of their capital contributions. Zaid ibn Ali said: Partnership is of two kinds, partnership of limited scope (inan) and partnership of absolute delegation (mufawada). The inan partnership is when two partners engage in a specific type of commerce, and the mufawada partnership is when two partners are partners in every little and much. Zaid ibn Ali said: Whatever liability binds one of the absolute partners binds the other. Whatever liability binds one of the limited partners does not bind the other, but he may recover from him in that if it was part of their trade.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever hires a worker must inform him of his wage. If he wishes, he agrees, and if he wishes, he leaves. Also narrated from Ali: That he came with a porter who had a large vial of oil upon him, and he broke it thinking it was him (responsible).
